definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

sentences.english: They are farmers whose forefathers lived on this land.
sentences.chinese: 祖輩輩都住居在這片土地上的農民。

sentences.english: Chapter five: The technology of Mosuo people in the plateau of the Northwest of Yunnan province.
sentences.chinese: 第五章，滇西北高原摩梭人住居的建築技術體系。

sentences.english: This is a thesis about the dwelling of the low-income floating population.
sentences.chinese: 本文是一篇系統研究低收入流動人口住居問題的論文。

sentences.english: Eventually come to Hangzhou in the Late Qing Period Residence essential feature space.
sentences.chinese: 最終得出杭州在清末民初時期的住居空間本質特徵。

definition: public housing/dormitory, esp. for unmarried people
(of a group of people) to live scattered over an area
Zhao'an county in Zhangzhou 漳州[Zhang1 zhou1], Fujian
Jiayu county in Xianning 咸寧|咸宁[Xian2 ning2], Hubei
Ninghua county in Sanming 三明[San1 ming2], Fujian
Longting district of Kaifeng city 開封市|开封市[Kai1 feng1 shi4], Henan
Donghe or Tungho township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
